page.title: 04HISTORY OF THE VILLAGES
page.content: Ahoghill has a wide central{diamond} where it grew around the crossing of two main roads.In 1831 the population was only 421,but by 1881 it had doubled to 898.During this time it became a market centre,especially for{ {flax}with a monthly linen market and home handloom weaving in{Shuttle Row}. The streams nearby powered the water wheels of 3 flax scutching mills and 2 corn grinding mills.The old Straid Corn mill is being rebuilt at the{ {Ulster Folk Museum}at present. The village of Gracehill was built in 1765 by John Cennick whi established a {Moravian}community who wished to live apart from the rest of society. An architecturally protected village it remains unspoilt with large 3 storied houses built around the church and school in a grid-iron plan around a central square.
